text: Leiataua Soloa was a Western Samoan chief and politician. He served as a member of the Legislative Assembly from 1948 to 1951. ==Biography== Soloa became the high chief of Manono Island,M.J. Marples & D.F. Bacon (1953) "Observation on yaws and certain skin diseases in Manono, Western Samoa", Transactions of The Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene, Volume 47, Issue 2, pp141–147 and was given the chiefly title of Leiataua. Following the creation of the Legislative Assembly in 1948, he was chosen to represent Aiga- i-le-Tai by the three Fautua (high chiefs).W. Samoa's New Assembly Now Taking Shape: Samoan Members Chosen Pacific Islands Monthly, May 1948, p49 However, he was not re-elected in 1951. ==References== Category:Samoan chiefs Category:Members of the Legislative Assembly of Samoa
title: Leiataua Soloa
